CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper November 7, 1959, pg. 9, reads: "Boyd Wilson Plays Host - Boyd Wilson, board member of the Termon Avenue HOme for Children and prominent labor leader, played host to the young folk there at a Halloween party last Friday night.  The guests had a 'romping good time' at the affair, which featured all of the things which go with this seasonal activity.  Mr. Wilson preferring 'no publicity,' picked up the entire tab for the party.  It was such a grand gesture that The Courier decided Mr. Wilson DID deserve some publicity... In the lower photo, other guests strike a glamour pose for The Courier photographer. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of twelve young women gathered around table with balloons, for Halloween party sponsored by Boyd Wilson in Termon Avenue Home for Children
